sentences.sentence: A group of handsome gypsies( 吉普赛人 ) then came into the ring, and sat in a circle.
They began to play softly on their hand drums( 手鼓 ), moving their bodies to the beat, and singing along quietly.
They played very gently, very lightly touching the drums( 鼓 )’ skins with their long fingers, and their heads began to nod as though they were falling asleep.
Suddenly, they all began to scream( 尖叫 ) at once, and all the children were very afraid.
The gypsies( 吉普赛人 ) all jumped up onto their feet, and began dancing madly around the tent( 帐篷 ) beating their hand drums( 手鼓 ), and singing some wild love song in their strange language.
But in another moment they all dropped down again to the ground, and lay there quite still,
and were completely silent except for the sound of their drums( 鼓 ).
After they had done this several times, they disappeared for a moment,
and came back with a brown bear on a chain( 锁链 ), as well as several small monkeys.
The bear turned upside down and stood on his head, while the monkeys fought with tiny swords( 宝剑 ), and fired off guns, and pretended( 假装 ) to be soldiers( 士兵 ).
When they had finished, the children all stood up and cheered, and said that the gypsies( 吉普赛人 )’ performance( 表演 ) had been a great success.
But the funniest of all the performances( 表演 ) was undoubtedly the dancing of the little Dwarf( 小矮人 ).
When he came into the tent( 帐篷 ), walking like a duck on his short little legs, and swinging( 晃动 ) his huge head from side to side, the children all began to laugh.
The Infanta( 公主 ) herself laughed so much, that the priest( 神父 ) had to quietly warn her that it was not proper for a Princess( 公主 ) of Spain( 西班牙，地名 ) to act this way.
But even he found it difficult not to laugh at( 嘲笑 ) the Dwarf( 小矮人 ), and in fact nobody in the palace had ever before seen anything like him.
He had been discovered by two soldiers( 士兵 ) only the day before, running wild through the forest, and they had carried him to the palace as a surprise for the Infanta( 公主 ).
Perhaps the funniest thing about the Dwarf( 小矮人 ) was that he was complete unaware of his own ridiculous( 可笑的 ) appearance.
In fact, he seemed quite happy, and when the children laughed at him, he laughed as freely and happily as any of them.
At the end of each dance he gave them the funniest bow( 鞠躬 ), smiling and nodding at them just as if he were really the same as them, and not an ugly little Dwarf( 小矮人 ).
As for the Infanta( 公主 ), he could not keep his eyes off her, and at times it seemed he was dancing for her alone.
At the end of his performance( 表演 ), she took the beautiful white rose out of her hair, and gave it to him with the sweetest smile.
She had done this mostly as a joke, but he took the whole matter quite seriously, and kissed the flower with his rough( 干裂的 ) lips( 嘴唇 ).
Then he put his hand upon his heart, and lowered himself onto one knee in front of her, with a smile on his face, and his little bright eyes shining with( 洋溢着 ) pleasure.
When the Infanta( 公主 ) saw this, she could not stop herself from laughing, and she kept on laughing long after the little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) had run out of the tent( 帐篷 ).
She wanted the Dwarf( 小矮人 ) to come back and dance again, but her uncle reminded( 提醒 ) her that her birthday meal was waiting for her back at the palace,
and that after there would be a sweet and delicious birthday cake.

So the Infanta( 公主 ) ordered that the little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) was to dance again for her after they ate, and then she stood up and began to walk back to the palace, and the children and all the others followed her.
Now when the little Dwarf( 小矮人 ) heard that the Infanta( 公主 ) had ordered him to dance for her a second time, he was so proud that he ran out into the garden.
He kissed the white rose, and danced and celebrated wildly, not worrying about what other people thought of him.

article_info.previous: 虽然公主对父亲总是沉浸在对母亲的思念中的这一行为感到费解，但她仍旧和朋友们一同欣赏为她生日准备的精彩表演，这些表演都有：逼真的模拟斗牛竞技、感人的木偶剧以及来自非洲的魔术表演。
article_info.share_words: Now when the little Dwarf heard that the Infanta had ordered him to dance for her a second time, he was so proud that he ran out into the garden. He kissed the white rose, and danced and celebrated wildly, not worrying about what other people thought of him.

question.cn: 吉普赛人的表演怎么样？

analysis: 文中提到：“When they had finished, the children all stood up and cheered, and said that the gypsies’ performance had been a great success.”由此可知，答案选A。

question.en: What was the funniest of all the performances?

analysis: 文中提到：“But the funniest of all the performances was undoubtedly the dancing of the little Dwarf. ”因此本题选C。

question.en: How did the little Dwarf come to the palace?

options.cn: 他被一群士兵发现并被当作惊喜献给公主。
options.en: He was discovered by the soldiers and presented as a surprise for the Princess.

options.cn: 他自愿要求为公主表演。
options.en: He volunteered to perform for the Princess.
He was one of the Princess' friends.

analysis: 文中提到：“He had been discovered by two soldiers only the day before, running wild through the forest, and they had carried him to the palace as a surprise for the Infanta. ”因此本题选A。

question.cn: 公主要求小矮人做什么？
question.en: What did the Infanta ask the little Dwarf to do?

options.cn: 她让小矮人和她一起玩耍。
options.en: She asked the little Dwarf to play with them.
She asked the little Dwarf to leave the palace.

options.cn: 她让小矮人再跳一支舞。
options.en: She asked the little Dwarf to dance for them again.

analysis: 文中提到：“So the Infanta ordered that the little Dwarf was to dance again for her after they ate.”因此本题选C。
